summary: The Department of Defense (DoD) is a major part of the U.S. government, in charge of the country's military and national security. It has over 2.9 million employees, making it the second-largest employer globally. This includes active-duty soldiers, sailors, and airmen, as well as National Guard members and civilians. The DoD's job is to protect the nation and ensure its security. It is led by the Secretary of Defense, who works directly with the President. The department oversees three military branches and several intelligence agencies, ensuring the U.S. is prepared for any potential threats.
title: United States Department of Defense
